title: Developer Guide: Lightning Login (LNURL-auth)
summary: LNURL-auth is a deterministic, domain-isolated authentication protocol built on Bitcoin wallet key-pairs. Unlike OAuth, Passkeys, or email-based login solutions, Lightning Login introduces a cryptographically sovereign identity primitive with zero backend credential storage. This guide explains not only how to implement LNURL-auth, but why it matters for developers building modern, trust-minimized applications.

sections.title: The Internet Has an Identity Problem
sections.description: The internet's identity layer was never designed — it evolved through patches. Today, developers inherit a broken system full of friction, centralization, exploitable patterns, and brittle dependencies.
items: Passwords create credential databases that developers must guard forever, even though storing them is a liability.
Email-based accounts rely on corporate-controlled infrastructure — if a user loses access to their email, they lose access to your app.
OAuth (Google, Apple, Facebook) creates a surveillance identity layer where every login leaks metadata to a third party.
Identity Providers (IdPs) can unilaterally remove access to a user, and by extension, your service.
Developers must bolt together sessions, tokens, password resets, onboarding flows, and recovery systems — increasing attack surface.

sections.title: Why LNURL-auth Is Different
sections.description: LNURL-auth brings a minimal, open, cryptographically verifiable, user-controlled authentication primitive to the web. Users authenticate with a deterministic keypair tied to your domain — eliminating usernames, emails, passwords, and third-party providers.
items: Users authenticate using Bitcoin wallet keypairs — no personal data, no PII, and no email required.
Wallets derive a unique keypair per domain, eliminating cross-site correlation and improving privacy.
Servers don't store secrets capable of authenticating a user — they only store the user's pubkey.
The protocol is stateless, simple, and robust. The wallet signs a server-provided challenge, and the server verifies it.
LNURL-auth is transport-agnostic: scanners can be mobile wallets, browser extensions, desktop apps, or hardware devices.

sections.title: For Developers
sections.description: LNURL-auth gives developers a dramatically simpler, safer, and more sovereign authentication pathway.
items: Eliminate credential storage — no password database, no complex resets, no breached-hash liability.
A single user identifier (pubkey) becomes all you need — easy to version, migrate, or index.
Your backend only needs to verify signatures — a simple, well-understood primitive with decades of battle testing.
Perfect fit for serverless and stateless architectures where storing credentials is undesirable.
Composable with existing session frameworks like NextAuth, Lucia, or custom JWT logic.
